40 
41 SpeciesListDescriptor::SpeciesListDescriptor(std::string descriptor)
42  : m_gases(false), m_solids(false), m_liquids(false)
43 {
44  // First step is to look for implicit species defined by "{ rules }"
45  size_t is = descriptor.find_first_of('{');
46  if (is != std::string::npos) {
47  size_t es = descriptor.find_first_of('}', is);
48  std::string rule = descriptor.substr(is+1,es-is-1);
49  descriptor.erase(is, es-is+1);
50 
51  // Split the rules up
52  std::vector<std::string> rules;
53  Utilities::String::tokenize(rule, rules, "with", false);
54 
55  // First check phase rule
56  std::vector<std::string> phases;
57  Utilities::String::tokenize(rules[0], phases, ", ");
58 
59  for (size_t i = 0; i < phases.size(); ++i) {
60  if (phases[i] == "gases")
61  m_gases = true;
62  else if (phases[i] == "liquids")
63  m_liquids = true;
64  else if (phases[i] == "solids")
65  m_solids = true;
66  else if (phases[i] == "condensed") {
67  m_solids = true;
68  m_liquids = true;
69  } else if (phases[i] == "all") {
70  m_gases = true;
71  m_solids = true;
72  m_liquids = true;
73  } else {
74  throw InvalidInputError("species descriptor", descriptor)
75  << "Unknown phase keyword in implicit species rule. "
76  << "Possible phase descriptors are 'gases', 'liquids', "
77  << "'solids', 'condensed', and 'all'.";
78  }
79  }
80 
81  // Second the elements
82  std::vector<std::string> elements;
83  Utilities::String::tokenize(rules[1], elements, ", ");
84  m_element_names.insert(elements.begin(), elements.end());
85  }
86 
87  // Separate out the species names
88  separateSpeciesNames(descriptor);
89 
90  // Check on any species whose excited electronic states should be expanded
91  for (int i = 0; i < m_species_names.size(); ++i) {
92  const size_t size = m_species_names[i].size();
93  if (size > 3 && m_species_names[i].substr(size-3,3) == "(*)") {
94  m_species_names[i] = m_species_names[i].substr(0, size-3);
95  m_expand_states.insert(m_species_names[i]);
96  }
97  }
98 }
99 
100 //==============================================================================
101 
102 void SpeciesListDescriptor::separateSpeciesNames(std::string descriptor)
103 {
104  // First trim the descriptor string
105  descriptor = Utilities::String::trim(descriptor);
106 
107  // State-machine with 2 states (either in quotes or not)
108  bool in_quotes = (descriptor[0] == '\"');
109  std::string name = "";
110 
111  for (int i = (in_quotes ? 1 : 0); i < descriptor.length(); ++i) {
112  char c = descriptor[i];
113 
114  if (in_quotes) {
115  // Add everything to the name until we escape out of the quotes
116  switch(c) {
117  case '\"':
118  // Escape and add name to the list
119  in_quotes = false;
120  if (name.length() > 0) {
121  m_species_names.push_back(name);
122  name = "";
123  }
124  break;
125  default:
126  // Otherwise just add the character to the name
127  name += c;
128  }
129  } else {
130  switch(c) {
131  // All white-space should be ignored
132  case ' ': case '\n': case '\r': case '\t': case '\f': case '\v':
133  if (name.length() > 0) {
134  m_species_names.push_back(name);
135  name = "";
136  }
137  break;
138  // Cannot include quotation mark in a name
139  case '\"':
140  if (name.length() > 0) {
141  throw InvalidInputError("species name", name)
142  << "Cannot include quotation mark in species name.\n"
143  << " " << descriptor.substr(0, i+1) << " <--";
144  }
145  in_quotes = true;
146  break;
147  default:
148  name += c;
149  }
150  }
151  }
152 
153  // Push back the last name
154  if (name.length() > 0)
155  m_species_names.push_back(name);
156 }
157 
158 //==============================================================================
159 
160 bool SpeciesListDescriptor::matches(const Species& species) const
161 {
162  // Check if this species is present in the explicit list (includes excited
163  // state species which were implicitly defined using the '*' character)
164  for (int i = 0; i < m_species_names.size(); ++i) {
165  const std::string& name = m_species_names[i];
166  bool expand = (m_expand_states.count(name) == 0 ? false : true);
167 
168  if (species.name() == name)
169  return !expand;
170 
171  if (species.groundStateName() == name)
172  return expand;
173  }
174 
175  // Check if the species is described by an implicit rule
176  // Check phase
177  if (species.phase() == GAS && !m_gases) return false;
178  if (species.phase() == SOLID && !m_solids) return false;
179  if (species.phase() == LIQUID && !m_liquids) return false;
180 
181  // Check elements
182  Species::StoichList::const_iterator iter =
183  species.stoichiometry().begin();
184  for ( ; iter != species.stoichiometry().end(); ++iter)
185  if (m_element_names.count(iter->first) == 0) return false;
186 
187  return true;
188 }

193 struct NameEquals {
194  NameEquals(const std::string& str) : name(str) { }
195  bool operator()(const Species& s) { return s.name() == name; }
196  std::string name;
197 };
198 
200 struct GroundStateNameEquals {
201  GroundStateNameEquals(const std::string& str) : name(str) { }
202  bool operator()(const Species& s) { return s.groundStateName() == name; }
203  std::string name;
204 };
205 
207 struct TypeEquals {
208  TypeEquals(ParticleType t) : type(t) { }
209  bool operator()(const Species& s) { return s.type() == type; }
210  ParticleType type;
211 };
212 
214 struct IsCondensed {
215  bool operator()(const Species& s) { return s.phase() != GAS; }
216 };
217 
218 void SpeciesListDescriptor::order(
219  std::list<Species>& input, std::vector<Species>& output,
220  std::vector<std::string>& missing) const
221 {
222  std::list<Species> ordered_list;
223 
224  int index = 0;
225  std::list<Species>::iterator it;
226 
227  // First order all of the species that are explicitly listed
228  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < m_species_names.size(); ++i) {
229  const std::string& name = m_species_names[i];
230 
231  // Don't expand name
232  if (m_expand_states.find(name) == m_expand_states.end()) {
233  it = std::find_if(input.begin(), input.end(), NameEquals(name));
234 
235  if (it == input.end())
236  missing.push_back(name);
237  else {
238  ordered_list.push_back(*it);
239  input.erase(it);
240  }
241  // Expand name
242  } else {
243  it = std::find_if(
244  input.begin(), input.end(), GroundStateNameEquals(name));
245 
246  std::list<Species>::iterator lowest_level = it;
247  while (lowest_level != input.end()) {
248  it++;
249  it = std::find_if(it, input.end(), GroundStateNameEquals(name));
250  while (it != input.end()) {
251  if (it->level() < lowest_level->level())
252  lowest_level = it;
253  it++;
254  it = std::find_if(
255  it, input.end(), GroundStateNameEquals(name));
256  }
257 
258  ordered_list.push_back(*lowest_level);
259  input.erase(lowest_level);
260 
261  it = std::find_if(
262  input.begin(), input.end(), GroundStateNameEquals(name));
263  lowest_level = it;
264  }
265  }
266  }
267 
268  // Return early if we are missing some species as this is an error
269  if (missing.size() > 0)
270  return;
271 
272  // Now all that remains are the species that were implicitly defined
273  ordered_list.insert(ordered_list.end(), input.begin(), input.end());
274  input.clear();
275 
276  // Place the electron first
277  it = find_if(
278  ordered_list.begin(), ordered_list.end(), TypeEquals(ELECTRON));
279 
280  if (it != ordered_list.begin() && it != ordered_list.end())
281  ordered_list.splice(ordered_list.begin(), ordered_list, it);
282 
283  // Move all condensed species to the end of the list
284  int ncond = count_if(
285  ordered_list.begin(), ordered_list.end(), IsCondensed());
286 
287  while (ncond-- > 0) {
288  it = std::find_if(
289  ordered_list.begin(), ordered_list.end(), IsCondensed());
290  ordered_list.splice(ordered_list.end(), ordered_list, it);
291  }
292 
293  // Finally copy the list to the output vector
294  output.assign(ordered_list.begin(), ordered_list.end());
295 }
